definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Can I place tomorrow's gold in today's purse?
sentences.chinese: 我能把明天的金币放进今天的钱袋里吗？

sentences.english: Better an abandoned purse than an empty arch.
sentences.chinese: 宁肯钱袋瘪，不要脑袋空。

sentences.english: Better an empty purse than an empty head。
sentences.chinese: 宁可钱袋瘪，不要脑袋空。

sentences.english: He's right at my desk with a money belt .
sentences.chinese: 他正在我的柜台，还带着他的钱袋子来。

sentences.english: He drew two five - franc pieces from his money-bag and handed them to the priest.
sentences.chinese: 他从他钱袋里取出两枚五法郎的钱，交给神甫。

sentences.english: And again the family purse was empty.
sentences.chinese: 于是，家里的钱袋子又空了。

sentences.english: As the rest of the prospectus shows, lining the founders' pockets is all Groupon cares about.
sentences.chinese: 招股说明显示，梅森等人关心的只是自己的钱袋。

sentences.english: Anyway, people's life has changed a lot with inflated money-pockets.
sentences.chinese: 总而言之，人们的钱袋还是鼓了，生活也随着变美了。

sentences.english: They are great just to keep in your purse or diaper bag for on the go.
sentences.chinese: 在钱袋或是尿布包里揣上一包会很方便。

sentences.english: Holds your credit cards, currency, keys and a slim cell phone.
sentences.chinese: 有专门的信用卡袋，钱袋子，钥匙和一个超薄手机袋。

sentences.english: Because the phrase "old-lady purse" exists for a reason.
sentences.chinese: 因为“老妇人的钱袋”这句俗语是有理由的。

sentences.english: Try veggies in place of a meat dish once a week and the dollars will add up.
sentences.chinese: 一周一次尝试用蔬菜代替肉食，你的钱袋会鼓起来的。

sentences.english: And yet, however their pockets they may stuff, they have never enough.
sentences.chinese: 然而，无论他们的钱袋多满，他们却永远不满足。

sentences.english: In this way, the maid cleared herself of the injustice and the thief got the moneybag.
sentences.chinese: 这样，女仆洗清了冤屈，钱袋也到了那骗子手上。

sentences.english: They all paint tables, cover screens, and net purses.
sentences.chinese: 她们都会装饰台桌，点缀屏风，编织钱袋。

sentences.english: Better an empty purse than an empty head.
sentences.chinese: 甘心钱袋瘪，不要脑袋空。

definition: embroidered pouch for carrying loose change etc/purse/pocket (in clothing)
(in former times) banknote with a value in silver
cloth pouch open in the middle, forming two bags/jacket worn for Chinese wrestling
to scatter money/to give to charity
small sum of money/loose change/Cantonese equivalent of 零錢|零钱[ling2 qian2]
waist purse (old)/(fig.) purse/pocket/waist pack/fanny pack/bum bag
to weigh in the hand/to estimate
pouch/sack/bag/Budai (the Laughing Buddha)/Budai or Putai town in Chiayi county 嘉義縣|嘉义县[Jia1 yi4 xian4], west Taiwan
